text: I feel insecure when talking about securities

たとえば <https://ca.rbcwealthmanagement.com/documents/695242/0/Withdrawing+Surplus+Cash+from+a+Corporation.pdf/b992e723-0f53-42b5-af6b-b0009d6a1f92> の
> Using borrowed money to finance the
> purchase of securities involves greater
> risk than using cash resources only.
> If you borrow money to purchase
> securities, your responsibility to repay
> the loan and pay interest as required
> by its terms remains the same even if
> the value of the securities purchased
> declines. Before implementing this
> strategy, it is important to understand
> the concept of borrowing to invest
> and all the related risks. Speak with a
> qualified tax advisor to determine if
> this strategy is suitable for you.
あたり
非日本語圏の日本語学習者には日本語ネイティブよりもきれいな日本語(と常用されない言葉)を話す印象がある

attachments.text: 同綴異義語（どうてついぎご、別称：同形異義語［どうけいいぎご］、英語：homograph）とは、同じ綴りでありながら異なる意味を持つ語を指して言う、言語学分野等の用語である。

text: > ドロン (*doron*) means “to leave”. It describes someone trying to slip out unnoticed, usually from a social obligation. Trying to leave the drinking party before your boss notices you're not there?

> In the previous lesson, we learned how to quote a relative clause by encasing it with 「と」. This allowed us to talk about things that people have said, heard, thought, and more. We also took a look at some examples sentences that used 「と」 and 「言う」 to describe how to say something in Japanese and even what to call oneself. In this section, we will learn that with 「と」, we can use 「いう」 in a similar fashion to define, describe, and generally just talk about the thing itself. We’ll also see how to do the same thing with the casual 「って」 version we first learned about in the last lesson.

日本語を精力的に勉強していた時代のこのチャプターを思い出したけど似た感じですねｗ:
<http://www.guidetojapanese.org/learn/grammar/define#Using_or_for>

text: ありがとうございます

なるほど、今調べた感じ `,which`だと
• 前の文全体 or 文の一部を説明できる
と書いてあったので一部分の方になるのか
厳密に言えば、"video of the elephant getting a little too close to the car"を修飾しています
これは前の文全体ではなく、videoだけを名状しているようですね
> Someone filmed a video of the elephant getting a little too close to the car, which he shared with his 5.4 million followers on Instagram just after it happened.
